subject: Nutrition
title: Gluten-Free for Everyone
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Gluten-Free for Everyone.

hook.text: Gluten-free products fill every aisle, but only about 1% of people actually need to avoid gluten.

buildup.text: Celiac disease is an autoimmune condition where gluten damages the small intestine. It's real and serious.

discovery.text: For the 99% without celiac, gluten is a harmless wheat protein that poses no health risk.

twist.text: Gluten-free processed foods often contain more sugar, fat, and calories than their regular versions.

climax.text: The gluten-free market is worth $7 billion annuallyâ€”mostly driven by people who don't need it.

punchline.text: One percent needs it. The rest pays more for less.

quiz.question: What percentage of people have celiac disease?
